titles.title: Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
The Ms. contains the following text: I) Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week” (fols. 3ra-158rb) I-1) Introduction (fols. 3ra-5rb) I-2) Eve of Palm Sunday (fols. 5rb-7va) I-3) Palm Sunday (fols. 7va-14ra) I-4) Monday (fols. 14ra-29rb) - Night hours (fols. 14ra-17va) - Day hours (fols. 17va-29rb) I-5) Tuesday (fols. 29rb-44vb) - Night hours (fols. 29rb-31vb) - Day hours (fols. 32ra-44vb) I-6) Wednesday (fols. 44vb-58vb) - Night hours (fols. 44vb-46ra) - Day hours (fols. 47ra-58vb) I-7) Thursday (fols. 58vb-76ra) - Night hours (fols. 58vb-60vb) - Day hours (fols. 61ra-76ra) I-8) Friday (fols. 76ra-133va) - Night hours (fols. 76ra-85vb) - Day hours (fols. 86ra-133ra), including: Homily by Jacob of Serug on Abraham (fols. 99ra-104va); Homily by Ephrem on Satan and on the death (fols. 105ra-108rb); Homily by ʾIsayǝyyas on Passion of Our Lord and the thief (fols. 108rb-115va); Homily by ʾAnǝsṭasyos of Däbrä Sina on the burial of Our Lord (fols. 115va-122ra); Homily by John Chrysostom on Passion of Our Lord (fols. 122ra-126rb) I-9) Raʾǝyä Yoḥannǝs "Revelation of John" (fols. 134ra-146rb) I-10) Saturday (fols. 147ra-158rb) - Night hours (fol. 147ra-va) - Mass (fols. 147va-158rb), including: Tǝmhǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat “Teaching of Mysteries” (fols. 154vb-158rb)
Additio 1.

donors.donor: Täśfa Ḥawaryat is mentioned as the donor in Additio 1; here the names of his relatives are also mentioned: his father Gäbrä Mäsqäl, his mother Nǝgǝśt Maryam, his brother Sämrä Krǝstos and his sister Sǝmǝrt Maryam.

txstates.txstate: The original sewing is for the most part missing. Most of the quires are reinforced by parchment guards. Many fols. are of different size and irregular shape; some of them are damaged (e.g., fols. 1-5). Fols. 46a and 158 are cut. Some fols. are stained with water (fols. 135rv, 136r-153r). Cuts are repaired on fols. 38, 85 and 138.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the back board is broken and repaired). Remains of pastedowns on the inner side of the front and back boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Small holes are visible in the centre fold of some quires.

bnothers.bnother: Most of the quires are reinforced by parchment guards.

txfolios.txfolio: + 46a (foliation mistake: the fol. after 46 and fol. 159 are not foliated; the pictures were given numbers 46a and 159)

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) - I(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 3r-10v) – II(6; s.l.: 2, stub before 7; 3, stub after 5/fols. 11r-16v) – III(7; s.l.: 3, stub after 5/fols. 17r-23v) – IV(8; s.l.: 1, no stub; 4, stub after 5/fols. 24r-31v) – V(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 5, stub after 4/fols. 32r-39v) – VI(8/fols. 40r-46a) – VII(8/fols. 47r-54v) – VIII(6/fols. 55r-60v) – IX(5; s.l.: 1, no stub; 2, no stub; 4, stub before 5/fols. 61r-65v) - X(8/fols. 66r-73v) – XI(8/fols. 74r-81v) – XII(4; s.l.: 2, stub before 3; 4, stub before 1) – XIII(7; s.l.: 3, stub after 5/fols. 86r-92v) – XIV(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 8; 8, stub after 2/fols. 93r-100v) – XV(4/fols. 101r-104v) – XVI(7; s.l.: 3, stub after 5/fols. 105r-111v) – XVII(8/fols. 112r-119v) – XVIII(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 6; 7, stub after 1/fols. 120r-127v) – XIX(4/fols. 128r-131v) – XX(2/fols. 132r-133v) – XXI(8/fols. 134r-141v) – XXII(5; s.l.: 2, stub after 2; 3, stub before 4; 5, stub before 1/fols. 142r-146v) – XXIII(3, stub 5; 5, stub after 3/fols. 147r-154v) – XXIV(5/fols. 155r-158v) – B(1; s.l. 1, stub before 1/fol. 159rv).

taunit.ln-info: The number of the lines varies from 29 (e.g., fol. 5r) to 37 (e.g., fol. 143r)
taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/E. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling (on a few fols. below the ruling, e.g. fols. 15r, 31v, 37v-39v, 47v, 78, 97-98, 147) The bottom line is written above the ruling. Some fols. appears to have a vertical margin line, ca. 1cm away from the vertical bounding line (s. fols. 66r., 67r, 68r)
One or two ruled lines were not used by the scribe at the bottom and at the top of some fols. (for the bottom s., e.g., fols. 13r, 26r, 41v-42v, 105v-106v, 126r; for the top s., e.g., fols. 4r, 30v-31r, 49r).
More than one line of ruling pricks is visible on fol. 105v.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Rght-sloping small rounded letters. The letters ዐ, at the 4th and 6th order, and መ, at the 1st and at the 2nd order have angular shapes. The quality of the handwriting changes, cp. fols. 123v, 124r, 130v, 131r. Some peculiar features: - The upper horizontal strokes of the letters መ, ሠ, በ are slanted to the left. - The loops of the letter መ in the 4th order are sometimes not separated (e.g., fols. 17ra l.29, 5ra l.23). - Coronis: fols. 46ar, 133ra.

rubrications.rubrication: A few lines (3-8) alternating with black lines in the incipit page of Texts I-1, I-9 and I-10, in the incipit page of the sections for the day hours of Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday (in Texts I-5, I-6, I-7), and in the incipit page of the Homily of Ephrem on Satan and on the death (in Text I-8); headings and incipits of the texts, their sections and subsections; titles of the Biblical books and other works; directives for the ministers in Text I-7; the words: mätärgwǝm in Text I-6, yǝtärägwǝm in Texts I-6, I-7 and I-8, nastäbäqwǝʿ ḫabekä in Text I-7, ʿƎgziʾo täśähalännä in “Tǝmhǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat” (Text I-10). Elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements; elements of the text dividers.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - The indication of the time and the day (በ፲ወ፩ሰዐት፡ ዘሐሙስ፡…) is missing for the 11th day hour of Thursday (fol. 75ra) and for the 1st night hour of Friday (incipit of Text I-8, fol. 76ra). For the 3rd night hour of Friday (fol. 78va), the number of the time is missing and the name of the day is Thursday instead of Friday. For the 6th night hour of Friday (fol. 79rb), the number is 3 instead of 6. - On fol. 104va, the Homily of Jaqob of Serug on Abraham (in Text I-8) ends with a subscriptio ascribing the translation of the homily, from Arabic into Gǝʿǝz, to Metropolitan ʾabba Sälama; besides, the original writing of the work is here attributed to Athanasius (Bishop of Alexandria from 328 to 373; cp. EAE I, 392): … ለዝንቱ፡ ድርሳን፡ ዘጸሐፎ፡ አቡነ፡ አባ፡ ሰላማ፡ ጳጳስ፡ ርቱዐ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ እምዐረቢ፡ ለግዕዝ፡ ተጽሕፎ፡ ዘይቤ፡ አባ፡ አትናስዮስ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ ይብጸሐነ። (?) - The ornamental bands on fols. 3r, 32r, 47r, 61r, 105r, 134r, 147r were conducted in a highly skillful manner.

additional.cont: Fol. 2v:  Exhortation to the community, supplication for the donor.
additional.add: Fol. 2v: በስመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አልዕሉ፡ ኵሉ፡ ነገር፡ ቅድመ፡ አንብቦ፡ መጻሓፍ፡[sic] ዘግብረ፡ ሕማማት፡ ወካዕበ፡ ስምዑ፡ አሐው፡ ፍቁራን፡ እለ፡ ተጸዋዕክሙ፡ ውስተ፡ ዛቲ፡ ቅድስት፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ቀሳውስት፡ ወዲያቆናት፡ ወሕዝብ፡ ወመኳንንት፡ አንስት፡ ወደቂቅ፡ ወካዕበ፡ ስምዑ፡ እንግርክሙ፡  ዝንቱ፡ ሕማማት፡ ወሕብረተ፡ ቃላት፡ ዘወሀቦ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ከመ፡ ይኩኖ፡ ረድኤተ፡ በሰማያት፡ ወበምድር፡ ተሥፋ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ፍቁሩ፡ ለፈረሳዊ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ከመ፡ ይተንብል፡ ሎሙ፡ ለእቡሁ፡ ገብረ፡ መስቀል፡ ወለእሙ፡ ንግሥት፡ ማርያም፡ ወለ፡ እኁሁ፡ ሰምረ፡ ክርስቶስ፡  ወእኅቱ፡ ስምርት፡ ማርያም። ምስለ፡ ኵሎሙ፡ ሰብኡ፡ ዓቢየ፡ ወንኡስ፡ ይጽሐፍ፡ ስሞሙ፡ ኀበ፡ ዓምደ፡ ወርቅ፡ ለዓለመ። ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ ወብሂለ፡ አቡነ፡ ሰዘበሰማያት፡ ኢትኅድግዎሙ፡ ኮመ፡[sic] ይኩንክሙ፡ ለተሥፋ፡ ወሎሙኒ፡ ይበቍዖሙ፡ ዘገብሩ፡ ሥምረተ፡ አምላክ።
additional.det: According to the note, the Ms. was donated to the church of Qǝddus Giyorgis (ʿAddi Qolqwal Giyorgis) by Täśfa Ḥawaryat. Besides him, his relatives are mentioned: his father Gäbrä Mäsqäl, his mother Nǝgǝśt Maryam, his brother Sämrä Krǝstos and his sister Sǝmǝrt Maryam. It has been written in a faded black ink by a second hand.

extras.extra:
- The scribe tends to exchanging ሠ with ሰ. This is especially visible in ተሣሃለነ፡ written also ተሳሃለነ፡ (s., e.g., fols. 157vb, 158ra). - Probably, cues for the rubricator, that is notes written mostly in bottom margins (but not only), in small script, repeating some rubricated words and lines in the text columns (headings of sections and titles of works) of the text, sometimes cut: fols. 27r, 28v, 29r-v, 30v, 31r, 49r-v, 79r-v, 129r, 131r. - Sign in the form of the cross: f. 48v.
- Corrections written over erasure: fol. 27ra. - Corrections written interlineally: fol. 27rb. - Crude note (personal names) with drawings on fol. 1v and fol. 2v (below Additio 1).

frames.frame: Ḥaräg 1-7: fols. 3r, 32r, 47r, 61r, 105r, 134r, 147r. 1) Fol. 3r (incipit of Text I-1): elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, azure, turquoise, white, black), horizontal ornamental band over cols. a-b, with three lateral extensions reaching the bottom of the page; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page; interlaces and geometric motifs. 2) Fol. 32r (incipit of the section for the day hours of Tuesday, in Text I-5): elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, azure, green, white, black), horizontal ornamental band over cols. a-b, with three lateral extensions reaching the bottom of the page; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page; interlaces and geometric motifs. 3) Fol. 47r (incipit of the section for the day hours of Wednesday, in Text I-6): elaborate, coloured (red, orange, yellow, azure, green, white, black), horizontal ornamental band over cols. a-b, with three lateral extensions reaching the bottom of the page; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page; interlaces and geometric motifs. 4) Fol. 61r (incipit of the section for the day hours of Thursday, in Text I-7): elaborate, coloured (red, orange, yellow, azure, green, white, black), horizontal ornamental band over cols. a-b, with three lateral extensions reaching the bottom of the page; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page; interlaces and geometric motifs. 5) Fol. 105r (incipit of the Homily of Ephrem on Satan and on the death, in Text I-8): elaborate, coloured (red, orange, yellow, azure, green, white, black), horizontal ornamental band over cols. a-b, with three lateral extensions reaching the bottom of the page; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page; interlaces and geometric motifs. 6) Fol. 134r (incipit of Text I-9): elaborate, coloured (red, orange, yellow, azure, turquoise, black), horizontal ornamental band over cols. a-b, with three lateral extensions reaching the bottom of the page; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page; interlaces. 7) Fol. 147r (incipit of Text I-10): elaborate, coloured (red, orange, yellow, azure, turquoise, black), horizontal ornamental band over cols. a-b, with three lateral extensions reaching l.9; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page; interlaces and geometric motifs.
